amendment.description: Substitute amendment to the Dornan amendment (A007) sought to prohibit any funds from being used to perform abortions in military medical facilities, except when the life of the mother was in danger, or in the case of a medical treatment or other facility of the Defense Department located outside the United States, and any cost incurred by the United States in connection with such a procedure was reimbursed from private funds.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, offered as a substitute to the Dornan amendment and printed as amendment No. 48 in the Congressional Record of August 1, 1995, that would allow abortions to be performed at medical treatment or other Defense Department facilities if the life of the mother would be endangered if the fetus were carried to term; or, in the case of treatment facilities located outside the U.S., if the cost incurred for the procedure is fully reimbursed with private funds.

action.text: Substitute (A008) offered by Ms. DeLauro to the Dornan amendment (A007).

vote.text: On agreeing to the DeLauro amendment (A008) Failed by recorded vote: 194 - 224 (Roll no. 641).
